ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Genuinely helps your Korean language grammar skills. Walked in fluent in speaking and essentially zero writing skills. Left with more comfort speaking and passable writing. Professor Choi is also great.
korean: reading, writing, speaking
Basic Korean grammar and reading, lots of new vocab
This course expanded by Korean vocabulary and grammar skills immensely. It further developed my heritage base in Korean.
From taking this course, I developed my Korean listening, hearing, and especially writing skills.
I thought this course taught me a lot of Korean language skills and I learned a lot about Korean culture as well.
Grammar, spelling, and vocabulary.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Well structured. Could have been better organized as to what was going to be tested. Other than that kept you engaged and made you study the vocabulary well.
nothing to improve
Strength: constant exposure to Korean and daily homework was helpful Weakness: sometimes the lesson plans seemed not to be very coordinated
A major strength about the course is that it covers a wide array of topics. One drawback may be that some teaching areas are not developed thoroughly.

Strengths: relaxed environment which allowed for a free, no pressure situation for students to make mistakes freely and learn. You can tell the professor cares about each student and puts in effort to adapt to everyone's varying skill levels. The professor made it fun and I looked forward to going every day. Weaknesses: wish there was more dialogue practice, pace was a bit fast at times and did not feel we thoroughly got to practice what we learned due to the pacing.

The strengths of this course is that there was a lot of student participation, and there were many different methods the professor used to teach the language including watching a drama and singing songs.
More opportunity to practice speaking.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Learning more about your own culture is always great especially in a great environment.
yes, especially if they want to learn korean!
Yes! Especially if you are a heritage speaker but cannot read or write, this is the perfect class for you.
Yes, I would strongly recommend this course to another student who wishes to improve their Korean writing, reading, and speaking skills.
Yes, to take advantage of the immersive language program if they are ready to commit to the work hours required
Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. It was challenging, yet I looked forward to attending class every day.
This course is good for students who want to strengthen foundations.
